comments:
Using M3 Final build on Linux RH9.0, I got the following problem when I tried to
create a CVS location to dev.eclipse.org.
The folder .ssh doesn't exist in my home directory.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/users/oliviert/.ssh/known_hosts (No such
file or directory)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.io.FileNotFoundException.<init>(FileNotFoundException.java:76)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java)
	at java.io.FileWriter.<init>(FileWriter.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh.KnownHosts.addHost(KnownHosts.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh.KnownHosts.verifyKey(KnownHosts.java:73)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh.Client.send_SSH_CMSG_SESSION_KEY(Client.java:668)
	at

	at

	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.open(Session.java:194)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteModule.getRemoteModules(RemoteModule.java:57)
	at

	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.repo.RepositoryRoot.getDefinedModulesCache(RepositoryRoot.java:116)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.repo.RepositoryRoot.getDefinedModules(RepositoryRoot.java:130)
	at
